name: Hyatt Market Street, The Woodlands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to spend basically 2 days and one night for our anniversary this past weekend at The Avia in The Woodlands. Let me just say we were very sad to have to leave Sunday morning. We were treated like royalty from the time we pulled into the drive way till we left Sunday morning. The Hotel, the rooms and the breakfast are as good and even better than I have ever had, but what makes the Avia Woodlands is the staff, period. I have traveled the world extensively and stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and this little hotel has the best service I have ever had anywhere. The parking staff, bell hops, front desk staff and especially Jason. Thank you for making our stay one we will never forget, hope to be back very soon!
reviews.title: Incredible Experience!

reviews.text: Arrived on Saturday from the UK with a hire car from George Bush and charged $15 per night to park my car. Fine if you have a maserati or ferrari but a hire car Ford Escape....woke up the next morning and realised the con as parking in the main car parks is free. Now the rooms are not bad and equivable in price to the marriot woodlands and better quality with free internet; the marriott charges. However the hotel facilities versus the marriot are not as good on the pool area; but then locality to market street is better. The worst point for the hotel is breakfast which is very slow and unispiring; one of the worst in the US I have stayed in - and I travel all round the world.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel but a number of minor service faults

reviews.text: I note you respond and challenge/answer everything which amuses me - lets be proactive - I am here till till Thursday (Room 320) - I dont want anything - just contact me in the room or leave me a message as I am busy with customers.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we stepped out of our car we were impressed. As mentioned previously the doors are opened for you at all times. The check in was smooth for the most part. One small glitch was that we were given a market view rather than pavillion. T hey made up for it by giving us two beverage tickets which we enjoyed poolside. The decor, ambience, staff and room were lovely. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay if going to Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion or shopping or dining out

reviews.text: We tried out Avia the night of Dave Matthews. We got the Presidential Suite (much to my mistake) and were totally blown away. We booked well in advance when we bought our DMB tickets and got a great price. This was less expensive than the Marriott Waterway and a whole lot better. We had a great time and will stay again for concerts. The staff was great and were very friendly and accommodating. The bedrooms were awesome and all light was shut out. The only one thing we missed was room service. Next time we will know and will plan on eating at the various options around the hotel, like Johnny Rockets.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Checked in for a five night stay booked by my company. I was immediately disappointed with my doll-sized room. Thankfully it was just me staying with one small suitcase, because two people plus two suitcases could not have fit in this room. The sheets were the scratchiest linens I have seen or felt in my life. The first night I fought to fall asleep due to thin walls and windows. I could hear people talking by the pool, I could hear people talking in the hallway and I could hear the elevator.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: After finally falling asleep I was awakened at 5am by the hotel alarm which I had not set. I could not figure out how to turn it off and the provided directions only explained how to set the alarm, therefore I simply unplugged it. Several minutes later the alarm goes off again even though it is unplugged and the screen was blank. There was a small battery compartment on the bottom of the alarm that could not be opened without a screw driver. I called the desk and requested they send someone to pick up the alarm outside of my door.
reviews.title: Perfect host hotel
Awesome Service and Best Rooms for a Great Night of Sleep
reviews.text: I had ordered "french toast with warm maple syrup" from room service. I received two pieces of cold, tasteless toast with cold syrup. The only edible item was bacon. My second evening I was determined to get some sleep because I had to get up at 3:30 AM for an offsite meeting at 5 AM. Upon rising at 3:30 I found there was no warm water. I ran the shower for several minutes and still no warm water. When I called the front desk twice they acted like it was a personal problem in which I did not understand how to operate the shower. Several hours later my colleagues without early meetings still could not take a shower. I had had enough at that point and checked out in order to switch hotels. The hotel's apology for those who did remain after the water incident was a small bag of cookies.

We used the Avia as our host hotel for our wedding. They did a great job at handling everything from making a variety of guests happy to helping host a Sunday breakfast to making the bridal suite something special.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone who stayed loved their rooms. People loved the pool and bar. And we hope to stay with you again soon!
reviews.title: If you're going to the Cynthia Woods Pavilion..

reviews.text: Thought hotel might be a weebit too gaudy for us, however, we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed for the promixity to the Cynthia Woods Pavilian & don't regret it. Price is reasonable considering rooms are spacious and very elegant. HEB w/i walking distance & restaurants too. Would recommend if going to a concert and have a long drive back. Pool is amazing!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.text: All the previous reviews are accurate. The property is lovely for several reasons… I do just want to point out a few things. Not really negative- but things I wish I would have known. The rooms are NYC / San Francisco small. The previous reviwers must have stayed in a suite. I asked the front desk if all the rooms were this small- and they said the standard rooms- yes. So check the square footage if that is important to you. But- The bathrooms are larger than normal. I really liked this aspect. Closet door was a drape- kind of different.
reviews.title: Small Rooms- but still great

reviews.text: The windows are not sound-proof. If you face the pool- you will hear the DJ until 10:30 or so. You will know what songs are being played- NOT just the beat. Ask for a room on the other side. The music went on from 6:00-10:30. This may bother some individuals. There are black out drapes for light.
reviews.title: Great location, nice room if you need...
Avia Woodlands Texas
reviews.text: The pool is very beautiful…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another unique aspect is the housekeeping staff shares one of the eleveators with the guests. You do not see this too often; if you have experienced this before, you know what I am talking about.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great spot for a girls getaway! Its very convenient to shopping and restaurants. It would also be perfect if you were attending a concert.The decor and architecture is funky and cool and we had an awesome time just hanging by the pool (the food was excellent).
reviews.title: Great Location & Vibe, Comfort is So So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite. I slept on the fold out and was still feeling it a week later (although I probably should have expected that). My friends had a regular bed. One said it was fine the other said it was too hard. Our friends in another room were fine with their beds. However, both rooms were hot and we had a tough time getting them to cool down (they were at opposite ends of the hotel too).
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the weekend!!!!

reviews.text: One odd thing was that when the doorbell rang on our room the fire alarm would flash, which is rather unsettling until you figure out what's going on.
reviews.title: Had a excellent visit and will return.

reviews.text: In short, the location is superb but the comfort level could be a hit or miss.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I took my wife to the AVIA Hotel, this past weekend for our "baby-moon" before the birth of our first child. I must say, it was the BEST stay I have ever had @ a hotel. I felt like a VIP. Everyone was friendly and courteous and asked how they could make my stay better. We booked the "VIP" package and felt exactly like that. The rooms have GREAT views and are very clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast at the AWESOME breakfast buffet. Everything was fresh and GOOD! It is also reasonably priced for The Woodlands.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Elegance mixes with sassy-sophistication at AVIA, The Woodlands’ must-stay boutique hotel. With 70 rooms + suites, AVIA dons details like lush beds and Italian-tile bathrooms. Sample small plates, sip and socialize at the AVIA Kitchen + Lounge or inviting urban Terrace with fire pit and sexy infinity pool. Located 28 miles north of Houston, perfectly situated on Market Street The Woodlands, the region’s premier shopping and dining destination and near Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion, AVIA is surrounded by local hotspots.
